habitat: Grows in European woodlands and hardwood forests in springtime.
shortDescription: A deadly poisonous white mushroom with a silky, shiny cap, stocky stem, and volva, very similar to Amanita phalloides but completely white or light-colored.
edibility: Deadly poisonous, contains alpha-amanitin causing liver failure.
benefitsOrToxicity: Fatal dose of alpha-amanitin causes liver failure, phallotoxins. Symptoms appear 6-24 hours later: unease, cramps, diarrhea, then kidney and liver failure.

identification.cap: 5-10 cm diameter, pure white, egg-shaped to bell-shaped or flat with broad umbo, silky shiny, yellowish with age.
identification.stem: 9-15 cm tall, 0.6-2 cm diameter, white, fibrous, fragile ring high up, large sack-like volva buried in soil.

note: One of the most deadly mushrooms, implicated in several serious or fatal poisonings.
